author: Samuel Lovett
title: Incorrect grade threat prompts strong student reaction
text: Students have reacted strongly to the suggestion that exam boards have failed to mark exams properly and are "guesstimating" grades . With three days to go until A-level Results Day , teenagers have been left frustrated by the prospect that the results they receive could be incorrect. Up and down the country pupils have been airing their opinions on Twitter. Here's what they had to say: There were those that were angry: It is absolutely disgusting to think that we may receive incorrect A level results just because some examiners are too lazy to mark properly — Melissta Bombastic (@Melissasaur96) August 9, 2015 All this stuff about incorrect exam results makes me so so angry, they had ONE job — Amelia (@ameliapagliaro1) August 9, 2015 'Incorrect marking for A-Levels results' last year it was unfair marking liKE WHEN ARE THESE PEOPLE GONNA GET IT RIGHT — star wars (@itsmebrooke) August 9, 2015 ...while some went for the sarcastic response: "thousands of children are expected to receive incorrect a level results" well this fills me with absolute confidence — / c a r y s / (@idkcarys) August 9, 2015 So heartwarming to read articles about how A Level Results could be incorrect JUST BEFORE results day — Ben (@BenCrick) August 9, 2015 ...others took a much broader view on the whole situation: On a serious note tho A level results being incorrect doesn't surprise me seeing how little priority education has in this country lmao — Rez (@AliRezaaMahmood) August 9, 2015 ...and some didn't really know how to feel: "Students may receive incorrect A level results due to a lack of understanding of marking" don't know whether to be happy or scared — Childish Alvino (@nelsa029) August 10, 2015 ...while some even joked about taking vengeance: If i don't get into uni because of markers guesstimating and my a level results being incorrect i swear i'm coming for you @AQA @ocrexams — Tara // 87 (@immabeahippo) August 9, 2015 However, the optimists looked to make the best of a bad situation: If my results flop I'm blaming it on them being incorrect — RUCK (@Ruck__) August 10, 2015 Well at least if I get bad a level results I can blame incorrect marking http://t.co/nN7aGBThU0 — sam (@samjxnes) August 9, 2015 not being funny but if I open my results and I've passed, whether it's incorrect marking or not I'll take it — cay
